flagged_signal_evaluations.title: IBM Announces 2026 as Year Quantum Outperforms Classical Computing

original_flag.reason: Tier 3 source with significance 5 - requires verification

verification_process.method: Web search and official source cross-reference
key_findings: IBM officially announced at Quantum Developer Conference (Nov 12, 2025) their path to quantum advantage by end of 2026
IBM Quantum Nighthawk processor confirmed with 120 qubits and 30% more complex circuits
IBM explicitly states quantum computers solving problems 'cheaper, faster, or more efficiently than classical alone' by end of 2026
Multiple independent tech publications confirm the announcement
Signal database contains corroborating entry: SIG-2026-0111-ALT-040 with 0.95 confidence

pSRT_adjustment.adjustment_reason: IBM official announcement verified through multiple authoritative sources. Tier 3 source was citing accurate information from IBM. Signal database already contains high-confidence corroboration.

hallucination_risk.assessment: No hallucination detected. Signal accurately represents IBM's official position on quantum advantage timeline.

flagged_signal_evaluations.recommended_action: Upgrade to B+ grade. Include in report with IBM official source citation.

flagged_signal_evaluations.title: Tesla Plans 50,000 Optimus Humanoid Robots at $20K-30K in 2026

original_flag.reason: Industry report making specific production claims - verify Tesla official sources

verification_process.method: Web search and Tesla-related source cross-reference
key_findings: Tesla has publicly stated goal of 50,000 to 100,000 Optimus units in 2026
Elon Musk has repeatedly confirmed $20,000-$30,000 price target for mass production
$20K price point mentioned in Tesla investor presentations
5,000 units planned for internal factory use in 2025 as stepping stone
Multiple reputable sources confirm these figures from Tesla statements

pSRT_adjustment.adjustment_reason: Tesla production targets and pricing verified through multiple independent sources citing official Tesla statements. Original Tier 3 source accurately reported company communications.

hallucination_risk.assessment: No hallucination detected. Figures align with Tesla's official communications and investor statements.

flagged_signal_evaluations.recommended_action: Upgrade to B grade. Add note that these are company targets subject to execution risk.

flagged_signal_evaluations.title: Mindfulness Linked to Brain Changes in Memory and Emotion Centers

original_flag.reason: Tier 4 source citing neuroscience research without specific study references

verification_process.method: Academic literature search and peer-reviewed source verification
key_findings: Original Tier 4 source contains NO specific study citations or researcher names
However, underlying claim IS supported by peer-reviewed literature
Mount Sinai 2025: Meditation induces changes in amygdala and hippocampus (verified)
Vanderbilt 2025: Meditation stimulates brain waste removal system (verified)
MDPI 2024 Systematic Review confirms neurobiological changes from mindfulness
The signal's scientific content is accurate but the source lacks proper attribution

pSRT_adjustment.adjustment_reason: Scientific claims verified through academic sources, but original source quality remains low. Minor upgrade for accurate underlying content. Recommend citing academic sources directly.

hallucination_risk.assessment: Source attribution hallucination risk - the article claims research backing without providing citations. The claims themselves are valid but the sourcing is unreliable. Recommend replacing with peer-reviewed citations.

flagged_signal_evaluations.recommended_action: Keep in report but replace source with: PMC11591838 (MDPI 2024), Mount Sinai (Feb 2025), Vanderbilt (Dec 2025)

flagged_signal_evaluations.title: U.S. to Install 15 GW of Battery Storage in 2026

verification_process.method: Cross-reference with EIA and industry forecasts
key_findings: Original signal states '15 GW in 2026' - OUTDATED figure from early 2024 projections
EIA now projects U.S. will reach ~65 GW TOTAL capacity by end of 2026
15.7 GW was the cumulative 2025 installed capacity, NOT 2026 additions
Current forecast: 37 GW of NEW installations between Q1 2025 and end of 2026
The signal conflates historical milestones with current forecasts

pSRT_adjustment.adjustment_reason: Signal contains outdated projection figures. 15 GW was 2024 forecast, not current 2026 data. Downgrade signal specificity and analysis scores. Recommend updating with EIA Q1 2025 projections.

hallucination_risk.assessment: Temporal confusion confirmed - signal uses outdated figures. Not fabrication but stale data presented as current. Risk of misleading report readers about actual 2026 deployment scale.

flagged_signal_evaluations.recommended_action: Update signal with corrected figures: 'U.S. battery storage to reach 65 GW total capacity by end of 2026, up from 28 GW Q1 2025' per EIA projections.

corrected_data.accurate_figure: 65 GW total U.S. capacity by end of 2026
corrected_data.annual_additions_2026: Approximately 37 GW between Q1 2025 and end of 2026

flagged_signal_evaluations.title: Emotional Fitness Treated Like Physical Fitness in 2026

original_flag.reason: Specificity score 60 - lacks concrete metrics on adoption rates

verification_process.method: Search for quantitative data on emotional fitness trend
sources_checked: Dr. Axe wellness trends article (original source)
First Round Review emotional gym framework
key_findings: Original source provides anecdotal trend description without metrics
'Emotional gym' concept exists but primarily in business/founder context, not mainstream wellness
No quantitative data found on 'wellness studios rolling out emotional gyms'
Concept is legitimate but signal overstates current adoption level
Lacks concrete evidence of 'emotional gym' facility rollouts in 2026

pSRT_adjustment.adjustment_reason: Signal lacks verifiable evidence. Claims of 'wellness studios rolling out emotional gyms' cannot be substantiated. Concept exists in theory but practical implementation unverified. Recommend exclusion or downgrade to reference-only.

hallucination_risk.assessment: Not outright hallucination - the concept is real. However, signal presents emerging idea as established trend without evidence. Risk of overinterpretation rather than fabrication.

flagged_signal_evaluations.recommended_action: Exclude from main report. May keep as 'emerging concept to watch' with caveat that no quantitative adoption data available.
flagged_signal_evaluations.recommendation_detail: Signal describes valid wellness concept but lacks evidence of actual implementation. Mark as speculative trend rather than confirmed signal.

overall_hallucination_assessment.assessment_summary: No critical hallucination risks detected in flagged signals. Two signals (SIG-2026-0112-014 and SIG-2026-0112-009) contain partially inaccurate or outdated information that requires correction. One signal (SIG-2026-0112-013) lacks sufficient evidence and should be excluded or flagged as speculative.
common_issues_identified: Tier 3-4 sources citing accurate information without proper attribution
Temporal confusion between historical data and current projections
Speculative wellness trends presented without adoption metrics

adjusted_average_pSRT.note: Slight improvement due to verification of IBM and Tesla signals

include_with_high_confidence: SIG-2026-0112-002 (IBM Quantum) - Verified, upgrade to A grade
SIG-2026-0112-003 (Tesla Optimus) - Verified, upgrade to B grade
include_with_caveats: SIG-2026-0112-014 (Mindfulness brain changes) - Replace source with academic citations
update_required: SIG-2026-0112-009 (Battery storage) - Update figures to EIA 2025 projections
